intro: Prestonia lenticellata, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, cylindrical stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
